content:
## Report

### EXISTING STRUCTURES

#### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (-14.0, -49.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (-14.0, -49.0) with coal fuel and iron ore input.
- Stone Furnace at position (-12.0, -48.0) with coal fuel and iron ore input.
- Burner Inserter at position (-13.5, -47.5) waiting for source items, connected to the furnaces.
- Wooden Chest at position (-13.5, -46.5) for storage.
- Transport Belts connecting the furnaces and chests.

#### Iron Plate Storage and Distribution System
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (-13.5, -44.5) storing iron plates.
- Iron Chest at position (-11.5, -44.5) storing iron plates.
- Burner Inserters at positions (-14.5, -45.5), (-13.5, -45.5), (-11.5, -45.5), and (-9.5, -44.5) for moving items between belts and chests.
- Transport Belts connecting the chests and inserters.

#### Electricity Generator at Position (-7.0, 23.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Boiler at position (-7.0, 23.5) with no fuel.
- Steam Engine at position (-3.5, 23.5) not connected to fluid.
- Offshore Pump at position (-9.5, 24.5) supplying water.
- Pipe network connecting the offshore pump to the boiler and steam engine.

### ERROR TIPS

#### Errors in Extracting Items
- Ensure the target chest has the required items before attempting to extract. Check the inventory of the chest to confirm availability.

#### Errors in Inserting Items
- Verify that the inventory contains the items you intend to insert. Attempting to insert items not present in the inventory will result in an error.

#### Inventory Management Errors
- Regularly check the inventory capacity to prevent it from becoming full. A full inventory will block further harvesting or item collection activities.

#### Inserter Waiting for Source Items
- Ensure that source items are available for inserters to pick up. If inserters are waiting, check the connected entities for item availability.

#### Fuel Management for Boilers
- Keep track of fuel levels in boilers to prevent them from running out of fuel, which will halt electricity production.
